content: Would it be accurate to say that only compileDecl guarantees a declaration has been passed to the kernel? And furthermore, that both the kernel and the compiler receive a declaration through compileDecl? If so, where does the path split, i.e., when do the transformations on a declaration stop being identical wrt whether it is going to the kernel or to the compiler?

no, addDecl sends a declaration to the kernel and compileDecl sends a declaration to the compiler (which should already have been sent to the kernel). To send a declaration to both, you use the aptly named addAndCompileDecl
ah ok fantastic thank you for clearing that up!
